item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Tuesday, December 10, 2024 at 6:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. I can now run a GPT-4 class model on my laptop (47 points | 13 comments)
2. Reducing CO₂ emissions with faster software (23 points | 11 comments)
3. Memory-safe PNG decoders now vastly outperform C PNG libraries (37 points | 4 comments)
4. The Shepherd 1.0.0 released: the init system written in Scheme (40 points | 2 comments)
5. Himalaya, CLI to manage emails: v1.0.0 (14 points | 1 comment)
6. How to Think About Time (28 points | 7 comments)
7. An Undefeated Pull Request Template (5 points | 1 comment)
8. An experimental (e)shell pager (5 points | no comments)
9. Compromising OpenWrt Supply Chain via Truncated SHA-256 Collision and Command Injection (42 points | 4 comments)
10. Douglas Crockford Is Not Your Dad (65 points | 86 comments)
11. Building a Tiny CDN With pyinfra and Chimera Linux (8 points | no comments)
12. The rule of least client-side complexity (11 points | 7 comments)
13. Apple’s use of Swift and SwiftUI in iOS 18 (11 points | no comments)
14. Rust Futures are not guaranteed to be lazy (10 points | 2 comments)
15. Parsing MIDI messages in Rust (9 points | 3 comments)
16. Tree Calculus (2 points | no comments)
17. C has its limits. If you know where to look (6 points | no comments)
18. What are you doing this week? (9 points | 40 comments)
19. What are the Magical Clocks for? (6 points | no comments)
20. Parsing millions of URLs per second (7 points | 1 comment)
21. TOML for configuration (4 points | 6 comments)
22. TCC and the macOS Platform Sandbox Policy (2 points | no comments)
23. Dual_EC_DRBG with Justin Schuh and Matthew Green (5 points | no comments)
24. Data structures as jigs for programmers (Go edition) (11 points | no comments)
25. Protected mode support in the original Windows 3.0 was basically a 1-man skunkworks project (35 points | 26 comments)
